title: Picture palaces
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Melbourne (Vic.) - Buildings, structures, etc
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Melbourne (Vic.) - Description and travel
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Melbourne (Vic.) - Social life and customs
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Motion picture theaters
description: Black and white photos of movie houses from Melbourne's recent past including the State Theatre, Capitol, Regent and Hoyts.  Part One of the project(delivered 3 Sept 2001): documentation of the photographic archive and reproduction onto digital beta.  Palaces in order of appearance: 1. Melba Theatre 2. Liberty Theatre 3. Odeon Theatre 4. Regent Theatre 5. Plaza Theatre 6. Hoyts De Lux - Bourke Street 7. Lyceum Theatre - Bourke Street 8. Capitol Theatre 9. Kings Theatre 10. Savoy Theatre 11. Palace Theatre 12. St James Theatre 13. Metro Theatre - Bourke Street 14. Grosvenor Theatre 15. Athanaeum Theatre 16. The Auditorium Theatre - Collins 17. Metro Theatre - Collins Stree circa 1941 18. Majestic Theatre 19. State Theatre 20. Forum Theatre
